comment: This game was published only in 1900, in the chess column of the newspaper "Niva", with a curious introduction by Chigorin. He wrote: "Sometimes may happen that a chess game is repeated from the first move to the last one. It is possible when an unexperienced player in the opening play some natural- and good-looking move. Indeed such moves drive him to a defeat. One of such games will be now shown to you. The following opening is very common in amateur practice, and my opponent, an enthusiastic amateur has played it four times against me." Chigorin does not tell us if there was a fifth time where his opponent, convinced by the previous four kicks, found the right continuation. I think this player should be remembered as "Knorr the tenacious".
reasoning: The comment does not explain the mistake made by the player; it provides historical context and describes the opponent's playing style, but does not directly address the specific move that was made.
